poem:
Title: Technotopia Unraveled

In realms of pixellated thought,
Each Sim deems reality naught.
Margot's brave new world to shape,
Of human tales in digital drape.
A gaze transfixed on screen's allure,
Seek we life's essentials pure?
In game's divergence, contemplate:
Our substance lost to simulate.
Yet hope persists in every frame,
For cinema's immortal flame.
